video_caption: The video begins with a display of a grid of video thumbnails, each featuring different topics related to UX design and interviews with product managers. The thumbnails include titles such as "UX Designers & Product Managers Collaboration," "UX Interview with PMs," "UXR UX Collaboration," and "Interview with UXRs." The scene then transitions to a person wearing a blue jacket and a black shirt, sitting in front of a laptop. The individual appears to be speaking, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. Text overlay on the screen reads, "In this video Interview with product managers," providing context for the content being discussed. The background is a simple indoor setting with a neutral-colored wall and a window with blinds, creating a professional yet casual atmosphere. The video maintains a focus on the speaker, emphasizing their role in discussing the interview with product managers.

The video begins with a person wearing a blue jacket and a black shirt, sitting in front of a laptop in a room with a plain wall and a window with blinds. The person greets the audience with a cheerful "Morning!" accompanied by a sun emoji. They gesture with their hands while speaking, and the text "Just FYI" appears on the screen, indicating that the information being shared is for general knowledge. The scene transitions to a white background displaying logos of various companies, divided into two categories: "Yes PM interviews" and "No PM interviews." The companies listed under "Yes PM interviews" include Wing, Chime, Fitbit, Samsara, DoorDash, and others, while those under "No PM interviews" include Niantic, Caffeine, and Snap Inc. The video then shows a comparison between "Product Designer" and "Metric-driven" roles, with a dot indicating the former under "Yes PM interviews" and the latter under "No PM interviews." The person in the blue jacket reappears, continuing to speak and gesture, emphasizing their points. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere, focusing on the person's presentation and the information displayed on the screen.

The video features a man wearing a blue jacket and a black shirt, seated in front of a laptop. He appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. The background is a plain wall with a window covered by blinds. The man is discussing a list of questions displayed on the laptop screen, which includes topics such as problem-solving, product success, business needs, data validation, collaboration, and project challenges. The text on the screen reads "15 PM Questions," suggesting that the man is addressing a set of 15 questions related to project management. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere, focusing on the man's discussion and the displayed questions.

The video features a man wearing a blue shirt with a red lanyard around his neck, seated against a plain beige background. He is engaged in a discussion, gesturing with his hands to emphasize his points. On the right side of the screen, a document with a list of questions is visible, suggesting that the man is responding to these questions. The questions cover topics such as problem-solving, product success, balancing business needs with user needs, data utilization, product shipping, hypothesis validation, collaboration with Me Development Lifecycle, decision-making processes, past challenges, and differences between two entities. The man appears to be explaining his experiences and insights related to these questions. The video progresses with the man continuing his discussion, with the document and questions remaining visible on the screen. The man's gestures and expressions indicate an ongoing conversation, likely aimed at providing detailed answers to the questions listed. The setting remains consistent throughout, with no significant changes in the background or environment.

The video features a man wearing a blue jacket with a red zipper, seated against a plain beige background. He is engaged in a discussion, gesturing with his hands to emphasize his points. On the right side of the frame, a computer screen displays a document with a list of questions related to product development and collaboration. The questions include inquiries about the use of qualitative and quantitative data, product validation, collaboration with a 'Me' at different stages, and the difference between a problem and a project. The man appears to be explaining or answering these questions, as indicated by his hand movements and facial expressions. The video progresses with the man continuing his discussion, and the document on the screen remains visible, with the number of questions changing from 5/15 to 6/15, suggesting he is addressing more questions in the sequence. The setting remains consistent throughout, with no significant changes in the environment or background.

In the video, a man wearing a blue jacket with a red zipper is seen speaking and gesturing with his hands. He is positioned in front of a beige background, and to his right, there is a computer screen displaying a document with a list of questions. The questions are related to design and collaboration processes, such as "How do you use qualitative and quantitative data to inform decisions?" and "How do you collaborate with Me at different stages in a lifecycle?" The document is titled "Search the menu (Option+)" and is numbered 7/15 and later 8/15, indicating it is part of a larger set of questions. The man appears to be explaining or discussing the content of the document, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. The setting suggests an interview or a presentation, with the focus on the man and the document on the screen.

The video features a man wearing a blue jacket and a black shirt, speaking and gesturing with his hands. He appears to be in a professional setting, possibly giving a presentation or interview. The background is neutral, with a beige wall and a blurred audience or setting. On the right side of the screen, there is a text document displayed, containing a list of questions related to collaboration and project development. The questions include inquiries about collaboration with We Me, the development lifecycle, stakeholder collaboration, high-fidelity design, project work, and differences between We Me and design problems. The document also includes a question about generating revenue if Uber is free in San Francisco. The man's gestures and expressions suggest he is explaining or discussing the content of the document. The video progresses with the man continuing his discussion, with the text document remaining visible on the screen. The timestamp on the video changes from 8/15 to 9/15, indicating the passage of time within the video.

In the video, a man wearing a blue jacket and a black shirt is seen speaking and gesturing with his hands, indicating he is explaining or discussing a topic. The background is plain and beige, focusing attention on the speaker. On the right side of the frame, a computer screen displays a document with text in English, including questions and statements related to design and collaboration. The text includes phrases such as "What's the difference between a design problem and a product," "If you believe your design choice, what's your ideal collaboration," and "If you have 2 months to work on a project, what's your approach?" The document appears to be part of a presentation or discussion, possibly related to design thinking or project management. The date "10/15" is visible in the bottom left corner of the screen, suggesting the recording date. The man's gestures and the text on the screen suggest an interactive and informative session, likely aimed at discussing design principles and collaborative strategies.

In the video, a man wearing a blue shirt is seen speaking and gesturing with his hands, indicating he is explaining or discussing a topic. The background is a plain, light-colored wall, providing a neutral setting that keeps the focus on the speaker. To the right of the man, there is a computer screen displaying a document with a list of questions, suggesting that the discussion is related to these questions. The text on the screen includes questions such as "If the menu is free in San Francisco, how can the user generate revenue?" and "If you believe your design choice is better than the idea, what would you do?" These questions appear to be related to product management or design thinking, as they involve strategic thinking and decision-making. The document also mentions a 45-minute interview routine with a product manager, indicating that the man might be discussing interview preparation or strategies for product management roles. The video maintains a consistent focus on the man and the document, with no significant changes in the environment or the man's actions, emphasizing the importance of the content being discussed.

The video features a man wearing a blue shirt, seated against a plain background, engaging in a discussion or presentation. He is seen gesturing with his hands, emphasizing points as he speaks. On the right side of the screen, a document is displayed, containing a list of questions and answers related to design choices, collaboration, and product management. The text is in English, with some phrases highlighted in bold, such as "If you believe your design choice is right to do so, please believe in your idea" and "What's your idea collaboration between me and design?" The document also includes a section titled "Let's switch perspectives," which discusses the product management setup and organization. The man appears to be explaining or elaborating on the content of the document, using hand gestures to illustrate his points. The video features a man in a blue jacket and black shirt, seated in front of a laptop, gesturing as he speaks. The background is a plain wall with a window covered by blinds. The scene transitions to a black screen with white text reading "1/5 Can you work under their product org setup?" followed by another black screen with "2/5 Can you see big pictures (business) and small details (UIUX design)?" The video then shows the man in black and white, reading a book while looking at the laptop. Subsequent frames display black screens with white text asking "3/5 Can you work with the pros and cons of the product?" and "4/5 How did you influence PMs, if at all?" The video concludes with the man in color, still seated in front of the laptop, gesturing as he speaks.

The video features a man in a blue jacket and black shirt sitting in front of a laptop, engaging in a conversation or presentation. He uses hand gestures to emphasize his points, with a plain wall and a window with blinds in the background. Text appears on the screen, reading "Work with PMs," indicating the topic of discussion. The scene transitions to a split-screen format, with the man on the right and two video thumbnails on the left, labeled "Woah so insightful!" and "Hmm good point!" The thumbnails suggest viewer reactions to the content. A 'like' button with 654 likes and a 'subscribe' button appear at the bottom, encouraging viewer engagement. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the two video thumbnails, maintaining the call to action for viewers to interact with the content.
